page.title: 12Housing in Haverfordwest(1)
page.content: The town and surrounding countryside contains housing of varying ages.The old part of the town consists of terraced housing, sash windows, with doors opening onto the pavement, in the form of large town houses and small two up two down properties. The general style is of block, brick or stone with cement rendering, long narrow windows and steep slate roofs.There have recently been restrictions on new building in the countryside.They are now mainly agriculturally linked.Most of the farmhouses are of more than 100 years old.Many have new bungalows built beside them for married children or retired parents.All new building must now comply with the planning regulations laid down by the Housing Department ensuring the Pembrokeshire style of windows, roofs and materials.
